image.altText: A close up of Peter Dutton on stage.

props.synopsis: Australian voters have delivered Anthony Albanese "a win for the ages" that should see Labor with more seats than at any point in its history.

title.children: LABOR'S LANDSLIDE WIN

image.altText: David smiles talking to two people.

props.synopsis: Labor has had few blemishes on its electoral record in the history of ACT federal representation. But last night, a fresh independent wave swept over Canberra, making life tougher for both major parties.

title.children: ACT voters show once again there's no such thing as a safe seat

image.altText: A side by side image of a man and a woman

props.synopsis: There's been a surge in support for independents in the ACT, with David Pocock re-elected to the Senate and first-time candidate Jessie Price poised for a possible upset for Labor in Bean.

title.children: Surge in support for independents in the ACT as David Pocock re-elected

image.altText: Liberal Party leader Peter Dutton speaks passionately behind a podium with a sign reading "Get Australia back on track".

props.synopsis: Election campaigns are often quite stage managed but the number of twists in the Coalition's public service policy has resembled a giant pretzel, leaving Canberra voters bewildered about what to expect for their city should the government change.

title.children: Coalition public service policy twists bewilder Canberra voters

image.altText: A woman with short, light hair, smiling outdoors.

props.synopsis: Queanbeyan-Palerang Regional Council is auctioning two dozen properties to recover unpaid rates. But local Gina Greentree says the council has bungled the process, with the farmer bidding for a lot she thought she owned.

title.children: Property of man dead for 65 years among lots auctioned for unpaid rates

image.altText: An artist's impresiion of a high-rise residential development.

props.synopsis: Two companies that made false claims about approvals for light rail stops near a luxury apartment building in Woden are fined more than $3 million each under consumer laws.

title.children: 'Scornful of consumers': Canberra companies fined millions over false advertising

image.altText: Kendrick Lamar smiles and points as he performs in a blue and black leather jacket, blue jeans, gloves and a black backwards cap

props.synopsis: No crying over this one, mates.

title.children: Kendrick, Doechii, Dominic Fike and more tapped for Spilt Milk's big return

image.altText: ABC election expert Antony Green smiles at the camera with his hands clasped behind his back.

props.synopsis: Former Australian prime ministers across the political divide pay tribute to Antony Green, the ABC's chief elections analyst who presented his final election last night and will soon retire.

title.children: PMs say farewell to Antony Green after he called his final election

image.altText: Assistant Minister to the Treasurer, Michael Sukkar holds a press conference in the Blue Room. He's wearing a white and blue tie

props.synopsis: Senior Liberal figures say the party must review the way it ran its election campaign, after it was reduced to just a small handful of seats across the Melbourne region.

title.children: 'Stop drinking the Kool-Aid': Liberals face Melbourne wipeout

image.altText: Two men smiling in suits with red umbrellas and red Labor signs.

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party secures just six seats across NSW amid fierce battle against Teal independent in blue ribbon Sydney electorate.

title.children: Liberals hold just a handful of NSW seats as Labor, Teal vote surges

image.altText: Dutton surrounded by family

props.synopsis: For election after election, Queensland has stood as a fortress for the federal Coalition. On Saturday night, Labor tore it down, seized a slew of seats, and stunningly took out Peter Dutton in Dickson.

title.children: Coalition Queensland stronghold becomes bloodbath

image.altText: An illustration of the map of Australia with multicoloured lines behind it

props.synopsis: Explore the results across the capital cities and the entire nation with these maps.

title.children: What was the result in your seat? Look up the map of your region

image.altText: Labor supporters in red t-shirts put their fists into the air and cheer.

props.synopsis: It was something no-one saw coming — not even Labor dared dream the election would go this well as it achieves double-digit swings in a landslide.

title.children: When the music stopped in Tasmania, the Liberals were left without a seat

image.altText: Two women hold up signs that say 'I'm backing Claire' at Labor celebration after the federal election

props.synopsis: Liberal defeats in the South Australian key battleground seats of Sturt and Boothby have prompted a scathing assessment from former senator Simon Birmingham, who said his party was in "rock bottom" territory.

title.children: Senior Liberal slams 'diabolical result' as Labor wins SA marginal seats

image.altText: Sepia-coloured school photo of smiling four year old boy in a school uniform

props.synopsis: Peter Norris's father was a violent bank robber who lived life on the run, dragging his boy across the country with him, until Peter refused to go with him one last time. It was the hardest decision he ever had to make.

title.children: Born into chaos and crime, Peter grew up on the run with his bank-robber dad

image.altText: Warren Buffett wearing a navy jacket and red tie speaking while sitting in a black chair and gesturing with his left hand

props.synopsis: Billionaire investor Warren Buffett shocks shareholders by announcing he wants to retire from Berkshire Hathaway at the end of the year, naming current chair Greg Abel as his preferred successor.

title.children: Warren Buffett announces plans to retire this year

image.altText: An AI-generated image showing Donald Trump dressed in white papal clothing as a pope raising his right index finger

props.synopsis: The US president draws widespread criticism over an image posted to his Truth Social platform that shows him depicted as the pope seated in an ornate chair, dressed in formal papal clothing.

title.children: Trump posts AI image of himself as the pope ahead of Catholic conclave

image.altText: A girl in a WWII uniform on a bike

props.synopsis: Kathleen "Kick" Kennedy was the closest thing America had to a princess, but her wild and romantic life has been lost to history.

title.children: When JFK's sister died, his family decided to 'cover up the scandal'

image.altText: Two men sit on chairs pulled together in the middle of a large hall adorned with marble

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president praised the minerals and defence deals made this past week between the US and his country, while also issuing a stern warning to Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy says talk with Trump at Vatican the 'best' they've had

image.altText: An overhead shot of red dirt land with a machine removing vegetation.

props.synopsis: The Australian Conservation Foundation says vulnerable species like the malleefowl and pink cockatoo are suffering a "death by a thousand cuts" due to land clearing.

title.children: Conservation foundation alleges illegal land clearing on NSW properties

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Welcome back for another week of embarrassment! Oops, I meant humiliation.

title.children: Think you're a trivia guru? Prove it

image.altText: A woman smiles outdoors. She wears a puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: Octogenarian Carolyn Robinson sets off on a 130-kilometre trek to reach Mount Everest's South Base Camp, 5,364 metres above sea level.

title.children: 80yo woman takes on 17-day hike to Everest base camp

image.altText: A boab tree as dusk falls.

props.synopsis: The annual Eta Aquariid meteor shower is about to peak. With dark skies, experts say this year's show is worth getting up for.

title.children: The Eta Aquariid meteor shower is about to peak. Here's how to catch it

image.altText: Three Magpies players embrace after AFL loss to Cats.

props.synopsis: Jack Crisp could not get Collingwood over the line against Geelong, but Magpies coach Craig McRae was left proud by his team's showing in the three-point loss at the MCG.

title.children: 'We look like winners': Magpies take pride in dramatic loss to Cats

image.altText: Jahream Bula hugs Charlie Staines.

props.synopsis: The Tigers beat the Dragons 34-28 to close out Saturday's Magic Round action thanks in no small part to a 12-point swing on the stroke of half-time as Jahream Bula went from in-goal to in-goal after Dragons forward Jaydn Su'A dropped the ball over the line.

title.children: Luai credits 105m try after Dragons' tryline blooper as the difference in Tigers' win

image.altText: Oscar Piastri, Lando Norris and Lewis Hamilton on the podium after the Miami GP sprint.

props.synopsis: Australia's F1 world championship leader Oscar Piastri finishes runner-up in a rain-hit sprint race at the Miami Grand Prix.

title.children: Piastri suffers 'cruel' fate in Miami Grand Prix sprint

image.altText: Donald Trump smiling while speaking at a black microphone and wearing a dark suit and blue tie

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump wants to decrease governmental spending by almost 23 per cent amid a sweeping restructure of domestic priorities, but will seek approval for a boost to defence.

title.children: Five key takeaways from Trump's plan to slash the US budget

image.altText: Sarah Billings after a race in Poland in 2024.

props.synopsis: Sarah Billings continues her solid overseas form, finishing second in the women's 800 metres at the Shanghai Diamond League meet.

title.children: Aussie Billings just misses national 800m record in Shanghai

image.altText: Qantas logo on Sydney Airport terminal glass

props.synopsis: A Qantas customer service employee has sustained head injuries after falling off an aerobridge in Sydney Airport, around 5 metres above the ground, earlier this afternoon.

title.children: Qantas employee in hospital after falling 5 metres from aerobridge at Sydney Airport

image.altText: harry bbc snip

props.synopsis: In an interview with BBC, Prince Harry has said that he wants "reconciliation" with the Royal Family.

title.children: Prince Harry wants 'reconciliation' but King Charles 'won't speak' to him

image.altText: Five people dressed as superheroes walk along a city street towards the camera, while looking up.

props.synopsis: Director Jake Schreier bring his indie film chops to the MCU and delivers a fresh take on the superhero genre that's able to be a crowd-pleaser and explore darker themes in equal measure.

title.children: As far as a Marvel movie goes, Thunderbolts* does things differently

image.altText: A soldier from the Papua New Guinea Defence Force aims his long back gun at an angle.

props.synopsis: Australia could get its own version of the UK's decorated Gurkha warriors under a new security treaty expected to allow PNG citizens to join the ADF.

title.children: Does the ADF want its own version of the UK's Gurkha warriors?

image.altText: A man holding a snake out in front of him.

props.synopsis: Scientists have used blood from an American man who injected himself with snake venom for years to create what they say is "the most broadly effective antivenom to date" — at least in mice.

title.children: Blood of man bitten by hundreds of snakes key to new antivenom

image.altText: Two men trail after a house that is in the process of being moved along a hill.

props.synopsis: A wave of dam building during the mid-20th century displaced dozens of towns, villages and First Nations communities. A public history project hopes to recover them.

title.children: These towns were drowned to make way for human progress
